clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Topical and Intravenous Tranexamic Acid in Surgical Treatment of Lumbar Degenerative Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Topical and Intravenous Use of Tranexamic Acid in Posterior Lumbar Interbody Fusion - A Prospective, Double-blind, Randomized Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto Nacional de Traumatologia e Ortopedia

clinical_study.source: Instituto Nacional de Traumatologia e Ortopedia

brief_summary.textblock: Lumbar degenerative disease surgery entails in a high blood loss, requiring often for blood transfusion. The cost and risks involved in the use of allogeneic blood have motivated research methods to reduce operative bleeding in these patients. One such method is the use of anti-fibrinolytic drugs, among which is tranexamic acid.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will enroll 144 middle-aged and aged patients undergoing Posterior Lumbar Interbody Fusion (PLIF) with the diagnosis of Lumbar Degenerative Disease. The primary aim is to determine if topical application of tranexamic acid is more effective than intravenous infusion at decreasing blood loss and blood transfusion perioperatively in middle-aged and aged patients presenting for PLIF surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Intraoperative blood loss (3 hours) plus 24 hours postoperative blood loss will be measured in ml/kg

secondary_outcome.description: Hemoglobin level less than 8g/dl, hematocrit less than 24% or others symptoms suggesting hypovolemia will be indicatives for blood transfusion intraoperative and postoperative.

clinical_study.condition: Other Fusion of Spine, Lumbar Region

intervention.description: Saline Solution 0,9% in situ, up to 100ml;
Saline Solution 0,9% in the vein, up to 500ml: 200ml as loading dose over 15 minutes followed by 1ml/Kg/hr throughout the surgery, in a maximum volume of 300ml
30mg/ml of tranexamic acid in situ during surgery, up to 100ml
5mg/ml of tranexamic acid in the vein, up to 500ml: 200ml (5mg/ml) as loading dose over 15 minutes followed by 1ml/Kg/hr (5mg/ml) throughout the surgery, in a maximum volume of 300ml.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of lumbar degenerative disease with segmental instability and/or lumbar stenosis;
- Having a body weight less than 100kg
- Indicative of Posterior lumbar interbody fusion in three levels or less
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of renal and hepatic insufficiency
- History of bleeding disorders and thromboembolism
- History coronary heart disease
- History peripheral vascular disease
- Commonly used anticoagulant drug
- Contraindication to the use of tranexamic acid
- Surgery history in the spine
- Religious restrictions on blood transfusion
